intro: Amethystanthus excisus var. leucanthus, commonly known as the white-flowered amethyst anthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale purple flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and a compact, bushy growth habit. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated for its elegant appearance and unique coloration.
